tool.name: miRkwood smallRNAseq

param.name: annotation_gff
param.label: gff file(s)
param.help: --gff : list of annotation files (gff or gff3 format). Reads matching with an element of these files will be filtered out.

param.name: min_read_positions_nb
param.label: --min-read-positions-nb
param.help: Minimum number of positions for each read to be kept.

param.name: max_read_positions_nb
param.label: --max-read-positions-nb
param.help: Maximum number of positions for each read to be kept.

param.name: align
param.label: Flag conserved mature miRNAs (alignment with miRBase + miRdup)

param.name: no_filter_bad_hairpins
param.label: Filter hairpins with a quality score of 0 and no conservation.

param.name: varna
param.label: Allow the structure generation using Varna

tool.help:
**What it does**
miRkwood is a software package for the discovery of microRNAs and their hairpin precursors in *plant* genomes. It combines multiple evidences to support the prediction: thermodynamical stability, conservation, miRNA:miRNA* duplex,...
miRkwood smallRNAseq takes as input a set of short expressed reads (from 15 to 35 nt) that have been previously mapped on a reference genome, and searches for all microRNAs present in the data.
Web page : http://bioinfo.lifl.fr/mirkwood/mirkwood.php
GitHub : https://github.com/miRkwood-RNA/miRkwood
**Input**
A set of reads produced by deep sequencing of small RNAs and then mapped to a reference genome, and then converted into bed with our custom script mirkwood-bam2bed.pl.
**Results**
- an HTML page with the results summary of the newly discovered miRNAS - an HTML page with the results summary of the miRNAs already known in miRBase - a log file - a ZIP archive containing all files produced by miRkwood
